name: Emergency Plumbing
shortDescription: 24/7 emergency plumbing services for urgent repairs, burst pipes, and plumbing disasters.
longDescription:
When plumbing disasters strike at 2 AM or during holiday gatherings, Wood's Plumbing is your lifeline. Our emergency plumbers understand that every minute counts when water is flooding your home or sewage is backing up into your bathroom. We maintain a dedicated fleet of fully-equipped service vehicles stationed throughout Southern Arizona, enabling response times that minimize damage and restore normalcy quickly.

Unlike companies that charge premium rates for after-hours calls, we believe emergencies shouldn't cost you extra. Our transparent pricing applies 24/7, whether it's a Sunday morning or New Year's Eve. Our technicians carry specialized equipment including high-powered extraction tools, pipe freezing kits for live-line repairs, and thermal imaging cameras to locate hidden leaks behind walls.

From burst supply lines flooding basements to failed water heaters threatening electrical systems, our emergency team has handled every scenario during 46+ years serving Tucson, Marana, Oro Valley, and surrounding communities. We coordinate with restoration companies when needed and document damage for insurance claims. When seconds matter, trust the plumber who answers the phone and shows up fast.
benefits: Guaranteed response within 60 minutes for critical emergencies
Same rates 24/7—no overtime or holiday surcharges ever
GPS-dispatched trucks positioned throughout Southern Arizona
Pipe freezing technology for live-line repairs without water shutoff
Thermal imaging cameras locate hidden leaks behind walls and floors
Direct coordination with water damage restoration companies
Insurance documentation and photography for claims assistance
46 years of emergency experience across 50,000+ service calls

process.title: Immediate Phone Triage
process.description: Our emergency dispatcher answers your call within seconds, asks targeted questions to assess severity, and provides immediate guidance to minimize damage while help is en route—like where to find your main shutoff valve.

process.title: Rapid GPS Dispatch
process.description: We locate the nearest available technician using real-time GPS tracking, routing them directly to your location. Most emergency calls see a plumber on-site within 30-60 minutes.

process.title: Damage Mitigation First
process.description: Before discussing costs, our plumber focuses on stopping active water flow, preventing electrical hazards, and protecting your property from further damage. Safety and damage control come first.

process.title: Transparent Emergency Pricing
process.description: Once the immediate crisis is contained, we provide a clear quote for permanent repair. No surprises—the price we quote is the price you pay, regardless of how long the repair takes.

process.title: Complete Restoration & Documentation
process.description: We complete the repair, test all systems, document the damage and repairs with photos for your insurance, and ensure your plumbing is fully functional before leaving.

name: Burst Pipe Repair
shortDescription: Immediate response for burst pipe emergencies. Available 24/7 to minimize water damage.
longDescription:
Burst Pipe Repair is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

Many Tucson-area homes built before 1990 have galvanized steel or copper pipes that have deteriorated due to our extremely hard water. Galvanized pipes corrode from the inside, restricting flow and adding rust to your water. Copper pipes develop pinhole leaks from the acidic water chemistry. Repiping with modern PEX or CPVC solves these issues permanently.

When you choose Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC for burst pipe repair, you get more than just technical expertise. You get plumbers who respect your home, communicate clearly, and stand behind their work. We show up on time, provide honest assessments, and charge fair prices—the same approach that has made us the trusted plumbing company for thousands of families across Tucson, Marana, Oro Valley, Sahuarita, Green Valley, Vail, Catalina Foothills, Casas Adobes, and surrounding communities.

Don't wait until a small problem becomes a major repair. Contact Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC today at (520) 682-2233 to schedule your burst pipe repair service. We offer free estimates, upfront pricing, and same-day service when you need it most.
benefits: Upfront pricing with no hidden fees
Whole-house repiping without major wall damage
Water quality testing before and after

process.title: Initial Contact
process.description: Call (520) 682-2233 or schedule online. We'll gather information about your burst pipe repair needs and schedule a convenient appointment.

process.title: On-Site Evaluation
process.description: Our licensed plumber arrives, evaluates the situation, and discusses options with you. We take time to understand your goals and answer questions.

process.title: Clear Pricing
process.description: Before any work begins, you receive a detailed quote. We explain what's included and there are never hidden fees or surprise charges.

process.title: Professional Service
process.description: We complete the work efficiently using quality materials and proven techniques. Our plumbers treat your home with respect, using floor protection and cleaning up afterward.

process.title: Quality Verification
process.description: We test all work thoroughly, explain what was done, and ensure your complete satisfaction. You receive documentation for your records.

faqs.question: How much does burst pipe repair cost?
faqs.answer: Costs vary based on the specific work needed. We provide free estimates with upfront pricing—you'll know the exact cost before we begin any work. There are never hidden fees or surprise charges.

faqs.question: Do you offer same-day burst pipe repair service?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer same-day service for most plumbing needs. Call (520) 682-2233 and we'll schedule the earliest available appointment, often the same day for urgent situations.

faqs.question: Are your plumbers licensed and insured?
faqs.answer: Yes, Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC is fully licensed under Arizona ROC #159621 and carries comprehensive liability insurance. Our plumbers are experienced professionals with ongoing training.

name: Emergency Leak Repair
shortDescription: Fast emergency leak detection and repair to prevent property damage.
longDescription:
Emergency Leak Repair is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

In Southern Arizona, slab leaks are particularly common due to the region's expansive soil and foundation movement. Hot water lines running through concrete slabs are especially vulnerable—the copper deteriorates faster in our alkaline soil conditions. Electronic leak detection is essential to locate hidden leaks without destructive exploration.

When you choose Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC for emergency leak repair, you get more than just technical expertise. You get plumbers who respect your home, communicate clearly, and stand behind their work. We show up on time, provide honest assessments, and charge fair prices—the same approach that has made us the trusted plumbing company for thousands of families across Tucson, Marana, Oro Valley, Sahuarita, Green Valley, Vail, Catalina Foothills, Casas Adobes, and surrounding communities.

Don't wait until a small problem becomes a major repair. Contact Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC today at (520) 682-2233 to schedule your emergency leak repair service. We offer free estimates, upfront pricing, and same-day service when you need it most.
benefits: Upfront pricing with no hidden fees
Electronic and acoustic leak detection equipment
Thermal imaging for hidden leak location
Slab leak specialists with foundation experience

process.title: Detection & Location
process.description: Using electronic listening equipment and thermal imaging, we locate the source of the leak without destructive exploration. For slab leaks, we pinpoint the exact location within inches.

process.title: Access Planning
process.description: We determine the best way to access the leak with minimal damage to your home. Sometimes the leak is accessible; other times we must work through floors, walls, or from outside.

process.title: Repair Options
process.description: Depending on the leak location and pipe condition, we present options: spot repair, section replacement, or rerouting if the existing pipe path is problematic. You choose the best approach for your situation.

process.title: Expert Repair
process.description: We complete the repair using appropriate materials and methods, ensuring a permanent fix. For slab work, we restore concrete and flooring access areas as neatly as possible.

process.title: Testing & Documentation
process.description: We pressure test to confirm the repair holds, run water to verify normal operation, and document everything with photos for your insurance company if needed.

faqs.question: How do you find leaks without tearing up my house?
faqs.answer: We use electronic leak detection equipment that can "hear" water escaping through pipes, even through concrete slabs. Thermal imaging cameras detect temperature differences caused by water. These tools let us pinpoint leaks within inches without exploratory demolition.

faqs.question: What is a slab leak?
faqs.answer: A slab leak is a leak in the water pipes that run through or under your concrete foundation. Common in Arizona due to soil conditions and copper pipe deterioration, slab leaks can cause foundation damage, mold growth, and high water bills if not repaired.

faqs.question: Will insurance cover leak repair?
faqs.answer: Homeowner's insurance typically covers water damage caused by sudden leaks but may not cover the repair itself or gradual damage. We provide thorough documentation to support your claim and can work directly with your adjuster.

commonIssues: Sound of running water when all fixtures are off
Warm or hot spots on floors
arizonaContext: In Southern Arizona, slab leaks are particularly common due to the region's expansive soil and foundation movement. Hot water lines running through concrete slabs are especially vulnerable—the copper deteriorates faster in our alkaline soil conditions. Electronic leak detection is essential to locate hidden leaks without destructive exploration.

name: Emergency Drain Cleaning
shortDescription: 24/7 emergency drain cleaning for severe clogs and backups.
longDescription:
Emergency Drain Cleaning is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

Tucson's hard water contributes to stubborn drain clogs as mineral deposits combine with soap scum and grease. The region's older homes—many built in the 1950s-70s—often have cast iron drains that corrode and narrow over time. Modern drain cleaning requires understanding these local pipe materials and conditions.

When you choose Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC for emergency drain cleaning, you get more than just technical expertise. You get plumbers who respect your home, communicate clearly, and stand behind their work. We show up on time, provide honest assessments, and charge fair prices—the same approach that has made us the trusted plumbing company for thousands of families across Tucson, Marana, Oro Valley, Sahuarita, Green Valley, Vail, Catalina Foothills, Casas Adobes, and surrounding communities.

Don't wait until a small problem becomes a major repair. Contact Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC today at (520) 682-2233 to schedule your emergency drain cleaning service. We offer free estimates, upfront pricing, and same-day service when you need it most.
benefits: Upfront pricing with no hidden fees
Camera inspection to verify complete cleaning
Safe for all pipe types including older homes
No-mess service with protective floor coverings

process.title: Problem Assessment
process.description: We evaluate the clogged drain, checking the severity and potential causes. We ask about history—recurring clogs may indicate a deeper issue that cleaning alone won't solve.

process.title: Method Selection
process.description: Based on the drain type and clog, we select the appropriate cleaning method: cable machine, hydro-jetting, or specialty tools for specific blockages. We explain the approach before starting.

process.title: Professional Cleaning
process.description: Our technicians use professional-grade equipment to clear the drain completely. We work carefully to avoid damaging pipes, especially in older homes with fragile cast iron or galvanized drains.

process.title: Camera Verification
process.description: For stubborn or recurring clogs, we run a camera to verify the drain is clear and identify any underlying issues like root intrusion, pipe damage, or buildup that could cause future problems.

process.title: Prevention Recommendations
process.description: We advise on preventing future clogs and recommend maintenance if your drains are prone to problems. Some drains benefit from periodic professional cleaning before they clog completely.

faqs.question: Why does my drain keep clogging?
faqs.answer: Recurring clogs usually indicate an underlying issue: pipe damage, root intrusion, improper slope, or buildup that cable cleaning doesn't fully remove. A camera inspection can identify the root cause and help us recommend a permanent solution.

faqs.question: Is hydro-jetting safe for old pipes?
faqs.answer: It depends on the pipe material and condition. We assess your pipes before recommending hydro-jetting. For fragile cast iron or damaged pipes, we may recommend gentler methods or repair before cleaning.

faqs.question: How can I prevent drain clogs?
faqs.answer: Avoid putting grease, coffee grounds, and fibrous foods down kitchen drains. Use hair catchers in shower drains. Run plenty of water when using the garbage disposal. Consider periodic professional cleaning for drains that tend to clog.

commonIssues: Slow draining sinks, tubs, or showers
Recurring clogs in the same drain
Water backing up in other fixtures
arizonaContext: Tucson's hard water contributes to stubborn drain clogs as mineral deposits combine with soap scum and grease. The region's older homes—many built in the 1950s-70s—often have cast iron drains that corrode and narrow over time. Modern drain cleaning requires understanding these local pipe materials and conditions.

name: Sewer Backup Emergency
shortDescription: Emergency sewer backup service to quickly resolve sewage issues.
longDescription:
Sewer Backup Emergency is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

Desert soil conditions present unique challenges for sewer lines in Southern Arizona. Tree roots seeking moisture aggressively infiltrate pipe joints, while the caliche layer common throughout the region makes excavation difficult. Additionally, monsoon season (July-September) can overwhelm older sewer systems, causing backups and flooding.

When you choose Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC for sewer backup emergency, you get more than just technical expertise. You get plumbers who respect your home, communicate clearly, and stand behind their work. We show up on time, provide honest assessments, and charge fair prices—the same approach that has made us the trusted plumbing company for thousands of families across Tucson, Marana, Oro Valley, Sahuarita, Green Valley, Vail, Catalina Foothills, Casas Adobes, and surrounding communities.

Don't wait until a small problem becomes a major repair. Contact Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC today at (520) 682-2233 to schedule your sewer backup emergency service. We offer free estimates, upfront pricing, and same-day service when you need it most.
benefits: Upfront pricing with no hidden fees
Trenchless repair options that save your landscaping

process.title: Initial Assessment
process.description: We start with a camera inspection to see exactly what's happening inside your sewer line. This reveals the location and cause of problems—roots, breaks, bellies, or blockages—without guessing.

process.title: Diagnosis & Options
process.description: Based on camera findings, we explain the problem and present repair options. This might include spot repair, pipe lining, pipe bursting, or full replacement, with pros and cons of each approach.

process.title: Clear Pricing
process.description: We provide detailed written estimates for each option. Sewer work can be significant—you deserve to understand exactly what you're paying for before making a decision.

process.title: Professional Repair
process.description: Our crew completes the work using professional equipment and proper techniques. For trenchless repairs, we minimize excavation; for traditional repairs, we restore the excavation area neatly.

process.title: Final Inspection
process.description: We perform a final camera inspection to verify successful repair, and coordinate any required city/county inspections. Your sewer line is flowing freely and problems are documented as resolved.

faqs.question: What causes sewer line problems?
faqs.answer: Common causes include tree root intrusion (trees seek the moisture in sewer lines), ground shifting and settling, corrosion in older pipes, and buildup from grease, debris, and mineral deposits. A camera inspection reveals the exact cause.

faqs.question: What is trenchless sewer repair?
faqs.answer: Trenchless methods repair or replace sewer lines with minimal digging—typically just two small access holes. Options include pipe lining (installing a new pipe inside the old one) and pipe bursting (breaking the old pipe while pulling in a new one).

faqs.question: How much does sewer line replacement cost?
faqs.answer: Costs vary widely based on length, depth, method, and access conditions. After a camera inspection, we provide detailed written estimates. Trenchless methods often cost the same or less than traditional excavation while preserving your landscaping.

commonIssues: Gurgling sounds from drains or toilets
Sewage odors in yard or inside home
Soggy spots or unusually green grass in yard
Sewage backing up into lowest fixtures
arizonaContext: Desert soil conditions present unique challenges for sewer lines in Southern Arizona. Tree roots seeking moisture aggressively infiltrate pipe joints, while the caliche layer common throughout the region makes excavation difficult. Additionally, monsoon season (July-September) can overwhelm older sewer systems, causing backups and flooding.

name: Water Heater Installation
shortDescription: Professional installation of tank and tankless water heaters. American, AO Smith, and ACT certified.
longDescription:
Water Heater Installation is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

Southern Arizona's hard water (averaging 15-25 grains per gallon in Tucson) creates significant challenges for water heaters. Mineral buildup coats heating elements, reducing efficiency by up to 30% and shortening tank life from 12 years to as little as 6-8 years without regular maintenance. Annual flushing and descaling are essential in this region.

When you choose Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC for water heater installation, you get more than just technical expertise. You get plumbers who respect your home, communicate clearly, and stand behind their work. We show up on time, provide honest assessments, and charge fair prices—the same approach that has made us the trusted plumbing company for thousands of families across Tucson, Marana, Oro Valley, Sahuarita, Green Valley, Vail, Catalina Foothills, Casas Adobes, and surrounding communities.

Don't wait until a small problem becomes a major repair. Contact Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC today at (520) 682-2233 to schedule your water heater installation service. We offer free estimates, upfront pricing, and same-day service when you need it most.
benefits: Upfront pricing with no hidden fees
All major brands installed and serviced
Annual maintenance programs to extend equipment life

process.title: Evaluation & Recommendation
process.description: We assess your current water heater and hot water needs—family size, number of bathrooms, peak usage times. We recommend the right type and size, whether tank or tankless, gas or electric.

process.title: Upfront Pricing Options
process.description: We present options at different price points with clear explanations of the benefits of each. You choose what works best for your budget and needs—no high-pressure sales tactics.

process.title: Professional Removal
process.description: We safely disconnect and remove your old water heater, disposing of it properly. We inspect the surrounding plumbing and make any necessary upgrades to support the new unit.

process.title: Expert Installation
process.description: We install your new water heater according to manufacturer specifications and local codes. This includes proper venting (for gas units), electrical connections, water line hookups, and expansion tank if required.

process.title: Testing & Education
process.description: We test the system thoroughly, adjust temperature settings for efficiency and safety, and show you how to operate the unit. You receive all warranty information and maintenance recommendations.

faqs.question: How long does water heater installation take?
faqs.answer: Most standard water heater replacements take 2-4 hours. Tankless conversions may take longer—typically 4-6 hours—due to additional gas line or electrical work and venting modifications.

faqs.question: Should I get a tankless water heater?
faqs.answer: Tankless heaters provide endless hot water and save space, but cost more upfront. They're ideal for smaller households or homes with limited space. We'll help you weigh the pros and cons for your specific situation.

faqs.question: How often should I flush my water heater?
faqs.answer: In Southern Arizona's hard water, we recommend annual flushing to remove sediment buildup. Regular maintenance extends tank life and maintains efficiency—especially important when water hardness exceeds 15 grains per gallon.

commonIssues: No hot water or not enough hot water
Water not hot enough or too hot
Higher energy bills without usage changes

Annual flushing and descaling are essential in this region.

name: Gas Water Heater Service
shortDescription: Specialized service for gas water heaters including safety inspections.
longDescription:
Gas Water Heater Service is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

In Southern Arizona, gas line work requires specialized knowledge of desert conditions. Extreme temperature swings (from 30°F winter nights to 115°F summer days) cause pipe expansion and contraction that can stress connections over time. Underground gas lines must also navigate caliche—the calcium carbonate layer common throughout Tucson and Marana—which requires specialized excavation techniques.

When you choose Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC for gas water heater service, you get more than just technical expertise. You get plumbers who respect your home, communicate clearly, and stand behind their work. Certified for all gas line work under Arizona regulations
Coordination with Southwest Gas for meter work

process.title: Safety-First Evaluation
process.description: Our licensed gas technician arrives and first checks for any safety concerns using electronic gas detection equipment. If a leak is suspected, we secure the area before proceeding with any work.

process.title: Complete System Inspection
process.description: We inspect all visible gas lines, connections, and appliances to assess the scope of work needed. For new installations, we evaluate the best routing and calculate proper pipe sizing for adequate gas flow.

process.title: Detailed Proposal
process.description: We provide a written estimate covering all work, materials, permits, and inspection fees. We explain your options and answer questions before any work begins—no pressure, no surprises.

process.title: Professional Installation/Repair
process.description: Our technicians perform the work using proper materials and techniques per Arizona gas codes. We pressure test all new lines and connections to verify leak-free operation.

process.title: Inspection & Documentation
process.description: We schedule the required inspection, meet with the inspector, and ensure approval. You receive documentation of all work for your records, and we verify all appliances function properly.

faqs.question: How do I know if I have a gas leak?
faqs.answer: Signs of a gas leak include the smell of rotten eggs (added to natural gas for detection), hissing sounds near gas lines, dead vegetation near underground lines, and higher-than-normal gas bills. If you smell gas, leave immediately and call us or 911 from outside the home.

faqs.question: Are you licensed for gas line work in Arizona?
faqs.answer: Yes, Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC is fully licensed for gas line work under Arizona ROC license #159621. Our technicians receive specialized training and certification for gas piping systems.

faqs.question: Can you install a gas line for an outdoor grill or fire pit?
faqs.answer: Yes, we regularly extend gas lines to outdoor kitchens, grills, fire pits, and pool heaters. We handle all necessary permits and inspections to ensure the work meets code.

commonIssues: Gas odor (rotten egg smell) indicating potential leak
Yellow or flickering pilot lights on gas appliances
Appliances not producing enough heat or flame
Higher than normal gas bills without usage changes
Corrosion or damage on visible gas pipes
Need to extend gas service to new appliances

name: Drain Cleaning
shortDescription: Professional drain cleaning for kitchen, bathroom, and floor drains.
longDescription:
Slow drains and recurring clogs aren't just inconvenient—they're warning signs of larger problems developing in your plumbing system. Wood's Plumbing uses advanced drain cleaning technology that goes far beyond the chemical solutions and basic snakes that only provide temporary relief. Our approach eliminates the clog AND the conditions that caused it.

We begin every drain cleaning with a thorough camera inspection to understand exactly what we're dealing with. Is it grease buildup from kitchen use? Tree roots infiltrating your sewer line? Years of mineral scale narrowing your pipes? Each situation requires a different solution. Our hydro-jetting equipment delivers up to 4,000 PSI of water pressure, scouring pipe walls clean and restoring full flow capacity—something no chemical or cable machine can achieve.

For kitchen drains plagued by grease, bathroom drains clogged with hair and soap scum, or main sewer lines blocked by debris, our technicians have the right tool for every situation. We also identify potential problems before they become emergencies, like developing root intrusions or deteriorating pipe sections. Serving Tucson and Southern Arizona for over four decades, we've cleared millions of feet of drains and can handle everything from a slow bathroom sink to a completely blocked commercial sewer main.
benefits: HD camera inspection reveals the exact cause and location of clogs
Hydro-jetting at 4,000 PSI scours pipes clean—not just punches through
Removes grease, roots, mineral scale, and years of buildup completely
Identifies developing problems before they cause emergencies
Safe for all pipe types including older clay and cast iron lines
Environmentally friendly—no harsh chemicals enter the water system
Restores original pipe diameter and flow capacity
Preventive maintenance plans keep drains flowing year-round

process.title: Video Camera Diagnosis
process.description: We insert a high-definition waterproof camera into your drain to see exactly what's causing the blockage—whether it's grease buildup, tree roots, collapsed pipe, or foreign objects. This prevents guesswork and ensures the right solution.

process.title: Blockage Assessment Report
process.description: Based on camera findings, we explain what we discovered, show you the footage on our tablet, and recommend the most effective cleaning method for your specific situation.

process.title: Professional Drain Clearing
process.description: Using the appropriate equipment—motorized cable machines for minor clogs, high-pressure hydro-jetting for heavy buildup and roots—we completely clear the obstruction and restore full drainage.

process.title: Post-Cleaning Verification
process.description: We run the camera through again after cleaning to confirm the drain is completely clear and inspect for any damage or developing issues that could cause future problems.

process.title: Prevention Recommendations
process.description: Based on what caused your clog, we provide specific tips to prevent recurrence and can recommend a maintenance schedule for drains prone to buildup, like kitchen lines in heavy-use homes.

name: Sewer Line Repair
shortDescription: Complete sewer line repair services using trenchless and traditional methods.
longDescription:
Sewer Line Repair is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

Desert soil conditions present unique challenges for sewer lines in Southern Arizona. Tree roots seeking moisture aggressively infiltrate pipe joints, while the caliche layer common throughout the region makes excavation difficult. Additionally, monsoon season (July-September) can overwhelm older sewer systems, causing backups and flooding.

When you choose Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC for sewer line repair, you get more than just technical expertise. You get plumbers who respect your home, communicate clearly, and stand behind their work. benefits: Upfront pricing with no hidden fees
Trenchless repair options that save your landscaping

process.title: Initial Assessment
process.description: We start with a camera inspection to see exactly what's happening inside your sewer line. This reveals the location and cause of problems—roots, breaks, bellies, or blockages—without guessing.

process.title: Diagnosis & Options
process.description: Based on camera findings, we explain the problem and present repair options. This might include spot repair, pipe lining, pipe bursting, or full replacement, with pros and cons of each approach.

process.title: Clear Pricing
process.description: We provide detailed written estimates for each option. Sewer work can be significant—you deserve to understand exactly what you're paying for before making a decision.

process.title: Professional Repair
process.description: Our crew completes the work using professional equipment and proper techniques. For trenchless repairs, we minimize excavation; for traditional repairs, we restore the excavation area neatly.

process.title: Final Inspection
process.description: We perform a final camera inspection to verify successful repair, and coordinate any required city/county inspections. Your sewer line is flowing freely and problems are documented as resolved.

faqs.question: What causes sewer line problems?
faqs.answer: Common causes include tree root intrusion (trees seek the moisture in sewer lines), ground shifting and settling, corrosion in older pipes, and buildup from grease, debris, and mineral deposits. A camera inspection reveals the exact cause.

faqs.question: What is trenchless sewer repair?
faqs.answer: Trenchless methods repair or replace sewer lines with minimal digging—typically just two small access holes. Options include pipe lining (installing a new pipe inside the old one) and pipe bursting (breaking the old pipe while pulling in a new one).

faqs.question: How much does sewer line replacement cost?
faqs.answer: Costs vary widely based on length, depth, method, and access conditions. After a camera inspection, we provide detailed written estimates. Trenchless methods often cost the same or less than traditional excavation while preserving your landscaping.

commonIssues: Gurgling sounds from drains or toilets
Sewage odors in yard or inside home
Soggy spots or unusually green grass in yard
Sewage backing up into lowest fixtures

Tree roots seeking moisture aggressively infiltrate pipe joints, while the caliche layer common throughout the region makes excavation difficult. Additionally, monsoon season (July-September) can overwhelm older sewer systems, causing backups and flooding.

name: Hydro Jetting
shortDescription: High-pressure water jetting to clear stubborn drain and sewer clogs.
longDescription:
Hydro Jetting is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

Hydro-jetting is particularly effective for Tucson's drain problems. The high-pressure water (up to 4000 PSI) cuts through the mineral scale that builds up in our hard water, removes stubborn tree roots, and clears grease blockages completely. Unlike cable machines that punch holes through clogs, hydro-jetting cleans the entire pipe diameter for longer-lasting results.

name: Trenchless Sewer Repair
shortDescription: No-dig sewer repair that preserves your landscaping.
longDescription:
Trenchless Sewer Repair is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

Desert soil conditions present unique challenges for sewer lines in Southern Arizona. Tree roots seeking moisture aggressively infiltrate pipe joints, while the caliche layer common throughout the region makes excavation difficult. Additionally, monsoon season (July-September) can overwhelm older sewer systems, causing backups and flooding.

When you choose Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC for trenchless sewer repair, you get more than just technical expertise. You get plumbers who respect your home, communicate clearly, and stand behind their work. We show up on time, provide honest assessments, and charge fair prices—the same approach that has made us the trusted plumbing company for thousands of families across Tucson, Marana, Oro Valley, Sahuarita, Green Valley, Vail, Catalina Foothills, Casas Adobes, and surrounding communities.

Don't wait until a small problem becomes a major repair. Contact Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC today at (520) 682-2233 to schedule your trenchless sewer repair service. We offer free estimates, upfront pricing, and same-day service when you need it most.
benefits: Upfront pricing with no hidden fees
Trenchless repair options that save your landscaping

process.title: Initial Assessment
process.description: We start with a camera inspection to see exactly what's happening inside your sewer line. This reveals the location and cause of problems—roots, breaks, bellies, or blockages—without guessing.

process.title: Diagnosis & Options
process.description: Based on camera findings, we explain the problem and present repair options. This might include spot repair, pipe lining, pipe bursting, or full replacement, with pros and cons of each approach.

process.title: Clear Pricing
process.description: We provide detailed written estimates for each option. Sewer work can be significant—you deserve to understand exactly what you're paying for before making a decision.

process.title: Professional Repair
process.description: Our crew completes the work using professional equipment and proper techniques. For trenchless repairs, we minimize excavation; for traditional repairs, we restore the excavation area neatly.

process.title: Final Inspection
process.description: We perform a final camera inspection to verify successful repair, and coordinate any required city/county inspections. Your sewer line is flowing freely and problems are documented as resolved.

faqs.question: What causes sewer line problems?
faqs.answer: Common causes include tree root intrusion (trees seek the moisture in sewer lines), ground shifting and settling, corrosion in older pipes, and buildup from grease, debris, and mineral deposits. A camera inspection reveals the exact cause.

faqs.question: What is trenchless sewer repair?
faqs.answer: Trenchless methods repair or replace sewer lines with minimal digging—typically just two small access holes. Options include pipe lining (installing a new pipe inside the old one) and pipe bursting (breaking the old pipe while pulling in a new one).

faqs.question: How much does sewer line replacement cost?
faqs.answer: Costs vary widely based on length, depth, method, and access conditions. After a camera inspection, we provide detailed written estimates. Trenchless methods often cost the same or less than traditional excavation while preserving your landscaping.

commonIssues: Gurgling sounds from drains or toilets
Sewage odors in yard or inside home
Soggy spots or unusually green grass in yard
Sewage backing up into lowest fixtures

name: Leak Detection
shortDescription: Advanced leak detection for water lines, gas lines, and sewer systems using state-of-the-art equipment.
longDescription:
Leak Detection is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

In Southern Arizona, slab leaks are particularly common due to the region's expansive soil and foundation movement. Hot water lines running through concrete slabs are especially vulnerable—the copper deteriorates faster in our alkaline soil conditions. Electronic leak detection is essential to locate hidden leaks without destructive exploration.

When you choose Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC for leak detection, you get more than just technical expertise. You get plumbers who respect your home, communicate clearly, and stand behind their work. benefits: Upfront pricing with no hidden fees
Electronic and acoustic leak detection equipment
Thermal imaging for hidden leak location
Slab leak specialists with foundation experience

process.title: Detection & Location
process.description: Using electronic listening equipment and thermal imaging, we locate the source of the leak without destructive exploration. For slab leaks, we pinpoint the exact location within inches.

process.title: Access Planning
process.description: We determine the best way to access the leak with minimal damage to your home. Sometimes the leak is accessible; other times we must work through floors, walls, or from outside.

process.title: Repair Options
process.description: Depending on the leak location and pipe condition, we present options: spot repair, section replacement, or rerouting if the existing pipe path is problematic. You choose the best approach for your situation.

process.title: Expert Repair
process.description: We complete the repair using appropriate materials and methods, ensuring a permanent fix. For slab work, we restore concrete and flooring access areas as neatly as possible.

process.title: Testing & Documentation
process.description: We pressure test to confirm the repair holds, run water to verify normal operation, and document everything with photos for your insurance company if needed.

faqs.question: How do you find leaks without tearing up my house?
faqs.answer: We use electronic leak detection equipment that can "hear" water escaping through pipes, even through concrete slabs. Thermal imaging cameras detect temperature differences caused by water. These tools let us pinpoint leaks within inches without exploratory demolition.

faqs.question: What is a slab leak?
faqs.answer: A slab leak is a leak in the water pipes that run through or under your concrete foundation. Common in Arizona due to soil conditions and copper pipe deterioration, slab leaks can cause foundation damage, mold growth, and high water bills if not repaired.

faqs.question: Will insurance cover leak repair?
faqs.answer: Homeowner's insurance typically covers water damage caused by sudden leaks but may not cover the repair itself or gradual damage. We provide thorough documentation to support your claim and can work directly with your adjuster.

Warm or hot spots on floors

name: Gas Leak Detection
shortDescription: Professional gas leak detection and emergency repair services.
longDescription:
Gas Leak Detection is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

In Southern Arizona, gas line work requires specialized knowledge of desert conditions. Underground gas lines must also navigate caliche—the calcium carbonate layer common throughout Tucson and Marana—which requires specialized excavation techniques.

When you choose Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC for gas leak detection, you get more than just technical expertise. Certified for all gas line work under Arizona regulations
Coordination with Southwest Gas for meter work
Complete permit handling and inspection scheduling

process.title: Safety-First Evaluation
process.description: Our licensed gas technician arrives and first checks for any safety concerns using electronic gas detection equipment. If a leak is suspected, we secure the area before proceeding with any work.

process.title: Complete System Inspection
process.description: We inspect all visible gas lines, connections, and appliances to assess the scope of work needed. For new installations, we evaluate the best routing and calculate proper pipe sizing for adequate gas flow.

process.title: Detailed Proposal
process.description: We provide a written estimate covering all work, materials, permits, and inspection fees. We explain your options and answer questions before any work begins—no pressure, no surprises.

process.title: Professional Installation/Repair
process.description: Our technicians perform the work using proper materials and techniques per Arizona gas codes. We pressure test all new lines and connections to verify leak-free operation.

process.title: Inspection & Documentation
process.description: We schedule the required inspection, meet with the inspector, and ensure approval. You receive documentation of all work for your records, and we verify all appliances function properly.

faqs.question: How do I know if I have a gas leak?
faqs.answer: Signs of a gas leak include the smell of rotten eggs (added to natural gas for detection), hissing sounds near gas lines, dead vegetation near underground lines, and higher-than-normal gas bills. If you smell gas, leave immediately and call us or 911 from outside the home.

faqs.question: Are you licensed for gas line work in Arizona?
faqs.answer: Yes, Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC is fully licensed for gas line work under Arizona ROC license #159621. Our technicians receive specialized training and certification for gas piping systems.

faqs.question: Can you install a gas line for an outdoor grill or fire pit?
faqs.answer: Yes, we regularly extend gas lines to outdoor kitchens, grills, fire pits, and pool heaters. We handle all necessary permits and inspections to ensure the work meets code.

Higher than normal gas bills without usage changes
Corrosion or damage on visible gas pipes
Need to extend gas service to new appliances

process.title: Detection & Location
process.description: Using electronic listening equipment and thermal imaging, we locate the source of the leak without destructive exploration. For slab leaks, we pinpoint the exact location within inches.

process.title: Access Planning
process.description: We determine the best way to access the leak with minimal damage to your home. Sometimes the leak is accessible; other times we must work through floors, walls, or from outside.

process.title: Repair Options
process.description: Depending on the leak location and pipe condition, we present options: spot repair, section replacement, or rerouting if the existing pipe path is problematic. You choose the best approach for your situation.

process.title: Expert Repair
process.description: We complete the repair using appropriate materials and methods, ensuring a permanent fix. For slab work, we restore concrete and flooring access areas as neatly as possible.

process.title: Testing & Documentation
process.description: We pressure test to confirm the repair holds, run water to verify normal operation, and document everything with photos for your insurance company if needed.

faqs.question: How do you find leaks without tearing up my house?
faqs.answer: We use electronic leak detection equipment that can "hear" water escaping through pipes, even through concrete slabs. Thermal imaging cameras detect temperature differences caused by water. These tools let us pinpoint leaks within inches without exploratory demolition.

faqs.question: What is a slab leak?
faqs.answer: A slab leak is a leak in the water pipes that run through or under your concrete foundation. Common in Arizona due to soil conditions and copper pipe deterioration, slab leaks can cause foundation damage, mold growth, and high water bills if not repaired.

faqs.question: Will insurance cover leak repair?
faqs.answer: Homeowner's insurance typically covers water damage caused by sudden leaks but may not cover the repair itself or gradual damage. We provide thorough documentation to support your claim and can work directly with your adjuster.

commonIssues: Sound of running water when all fixtures are off
Warm or hot spots on floors
arizonaContext: In Southern Arizona, slab leaks are particularly common due to the region's expansive soil and foundation movement. Hot water lines running through concrete slabs are especially vulnerable—the copper deteriorates faster in our alkaline soil conditions. Electronic leak detection is essential to locate hidden leaks without destructive exploration.

name: Pipe Repair
shortDescription: Repair cracked, frozen, or corroded pipes throughout your home.
longDescription:
Pipe Repair is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

Many Tucson-area homes built before 1990 have galvanized steel or copper pipes that have deteriorated due to our extremely hard water. name: Clogged Drain Repair
shortDescription: Clear stubborn drain clogs in sinks, showers, and tubs.
longDescription:
Clogged Drain Repair is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

Tucson's hard water contributes to stubborn drain clogs as mineral deposits combine with soap scum and grease. The region's older homes—many built in the 1950s-70s—often have cast iron drains that corrode and narrow over time. Modern drain cleaning requires understanding these local pipe materials and conditions.

When you choose Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC for clogged drain repair, you get more than just technical expertise. You get plumbers who respect your home, communicate clearly, and stand behind their work. We show up on time, provide honest assessments, and charge fair prices—the same approach that has made us the trusted plumbing company for thousands of families across Tucson, Marana, Oro Valley, Sahuarita, Green Valley, Vail, Catalina Foothills, Casas Adobes, and surrounding communities.

Don't wait until a small problem becomes a major repair. Contact Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC today at (520) 682-2233 to schedule your clogged drain repair service. We offer free estimates, upfront pricing, and same-day service when you need it most.
benefits: Upfront pricing with no hidden fees
Camera inspection to verify complete cleaning
Safe for all pipe types including older homes
No-mess service with protective floor coverings

process.title: Problem Assessment
process.description: We evaluate the clogged drain, checking the severity and potential causes. We ask about history—recurring clogs may indicate a deeper issue that cleaning alone won't solve.

process.title: Method Selection
process.description: Based on the drain type and clog, we select the appropriate cleaning method: cable machine, hydro-jetting, or specialty tools for specific blockages. We explain the approach before starting.

process.title: Professional Cleaning
process.description: Our technicians use professional-grade equipment to clear the drain completely. We work carefully to avoid damaging pipes, especially in older homes with fragile cast iron or galvanized drains.

process.title: Camera Verification
process.description: For stubborn or recurring clogs, we run a camera to verify the drain is clear and identify any underlying issues like root intrusion, pipe damage, or buildup that could cause future problems.

process.title: Prevention Recommendations
process.description: We advise on preventing future clogs and recommend maintenance if your drains are prone to problems. Some drains benefit from periodic professional cleaning before they clog completely.

faqs.question: Why does my drain keep clogging?
faqs.answer: Recurring clogs usually indicate an underlying issue: pipe damage, root intrusion, improper slope, or buildup that cable cleaning doesn't fully remove. A camera inspection can identify the root cause and help us recommend a permanent solution.

faqs.question: Is hydro-jetting safe for old pipes?
faqs.answer: It depends on the pipe material and condition. We assess your pipes before recommending hydro-jetting. For fragile cast iron or damaged pipes, we may recommend gentler methods or repair before cleaning.

faqs.question: How can I prevent drain clogs?
faqs.answer: Avoid putting grease, coffee grounds, and fibrous foods down kitchen drains. Use hair catchers in shower drains. Run plenty of water when using the garbage disposal. Consider periodic professional cleaning for drains that tend to clog.

name: Whole House Repiping
shortDescription: Complete home repiping with modern PEX or copper piping.
longDescription:
When your home's pipes reach the end of their lifespan, repairs become a game of whack-a-mole—fix one leak, another appears. Whole-house repiping replaces your entire water supply system with modern materials designed to last 50+ years, eliminating the cycle of recurring repairs and giving you peace of mind for decades.

Wood's Plumbing has repiped hundreds of Southern Arizona homes, from 1950s ranch houses with deteriorating galvanized steel to 1980s homes with failing polybutylene. We specialize in minimally-invasive repiping techniques that preserve your walls, ceilings, and landscaping. Using flexible PEX tubing, we can often route new supply lines through existing pathways, requiring far fewer wall openings than traditional rigid copper installations.

Our repiping crews work systematically room by room, typically completing an average home in 2-3 days. We coordinate with drywall contractors and painters if needed, managing the entire project so you deal with one company from start to finish. The result is consistent water pressure throughout your home, elimination of rusty discolored water, and protection against the flooding that aging pipes inevitably cause. We'll help you understand the warning signs that indicate repiping is necessary and provide a detailed assessment of your current plumbing system.
benefits: Eliminates recurring leaks and the damage they cause
Modern PEX piping carries 50+ year manufacturer warranties
Minimally-invasive techniques reduce wall and ceiling repairs
Restores full water pressure lost to corroded galvanized pipes
Ends rusty, discolored water from deteriorating steel lines
Flexible PEX resists freezing better than rigid copper
Single-source project management from pipes to wall repair
Increases home value and eliminates buyer concerns about old plumbing

process.title: Comprehensive Plumbing Assessment
process.description: We inspect your entire water supply system, identify all problem areas, test water pressure at multiple points, and determine the scope of work needed. We'll explain why repiping is recommended versus continued repairs.

process.title: Custom Installation Design
process.description: Our team designs the new piping layout to optimize water pressure and minimize wall penetrations. We identify the least invasive routing paths and plan the installation sequence room by room.

process.title: Systematic Room-by-Room Installation
process.description: We work through your home methodically, replacing old pipes with new PEX supply lines. We install modern ball-valve shutoffs at each fixture, enabling easy future maintenance without shutting off the whole house.

process.title: Pressure Testing & Inspection
process.description: Before closing any walls, we pressure-test the entire new system to verify zero leaks. We photograph all connections for your records and conduct a final walkthrough to confirm every fixture has strong, clean water flow.

process.title: Wall Repair Coordination
process.description: We patch all access holes we created and can coordinate drywall finishing and painting through our network of trusted contractors—one point of contact for your complete repiping project.

name: Water Conditioning
shortDescription: Comprehensive water treatment solutions for better water quality.
longDescription:
Southern Arizona's water is among the hardest in the nation, with mineral content that destroys appliances, clogs pipes, and leaves stubborn deposits on everything it touches. Wood's Plumbing installs and services water conditioning systems that transform harsh desert water into the soft, clean water your home deserves.

Hard water costs you money in ways you might not realize. Water heaters fail years early because calcium scale insulates heating elements, forcing them to work harder and eventually burn out. Dishwashers and washing machines clog with mineral deposits. Faucets and showerheads need constant replacement. Your skin and hair suffer from the drying effects of mineral-laden water. A properly sized water conditioning system eliminates all of these problems.

We offer multiple conditioning technologies to match your water quality, usage patterns, and preferences. Traditional salt-based softeners remain the most effective for extremely hard water. Salt-free conditioning systems prevent scale without adding sodium, ideal for those on low-sodium diets. Whole-house filtration removes chlorine taste and odor. We test your water, analyze your usage, and recommend the right system—then handle professional installation and teach you simple maintenance. With decades of experience with Tucson's unique water chemistry, we size systems correctly the first time.
benefits: Extends water heater lifespan by 5-8 years by preventing scale buildup
Eliminates spotted dishes, shower doors, and fixtures
Reduces soap and detergent usage by up to 50%
Protects pipes and appliances from damaging mineral deposits
Softer skin and more manageable hair from scale-free water
Multiple technologies available: salt-based, salt-free, and filtration
Custom sizing based on actual water testing and household usage
Local service and maintenance for all major conditioning brands

process.title: Professional Water Testing
process.description: We test your water for hardness, iron content, pH, chlorine, and other factors that affect water quality. This analysis determines exactly what conditioning equipment your home needs.

process.title: Usage Analysis & System Sizing
process.description: Based on your household size, water usage patterns, and test results, we recommend the appropriately sized system. Undersized systems fail prematurely; oversized systems waste salt and water.

process.title: Technology Selection
process.description: We explain the pros and cons of different conditioning technologies for your situation—traditional softeners, salt-free conditioners, whole-house filtration, or combination systems—so you can make an informed choice.

process.title: Professional Installation
process.description: Our technicians install your system to manufacturer specifications, including proper drainage, electrical connections if needed, and bypass valves for maintenance. We ensure optimal placement for easy salt filling and service.

process.title: Operation Training & Maintenance Setup
process.description: We walk you through system operation, show you how to add salt and check settings, and explain maintenance requirements. We can schedule annual service visits to keep your system performing optimally.

name: Gas Line Installation
shortDescription: Safe installation of gas lines for appliances and heating.
longDescription:
Converting to gas or extending gas service to new appliances requires precision work by licensed professionals. Gas line installation isn't a DIY project—improperly installed gas piping creates explosion and carbon monoxide risks that endanger your family. Wood's Plumbing holds the specialized licenses required for gas work in Arizona and follows strict safety protocols on every installation.

Whether you're running a new line for a gas range, connecting a backup generator, extending service to an outdoor grill or fire pit, or converting your water heater to more economical natural gas, our technicians have the expertise to do it right. We calculate pipe sizing based on total BTU demand, ensuring adequate gas flow to all appliances without pressure drops. We use only approved materials rated for natural gas or propane, and we leak-test every connection before putting the system in service.

Our gas line installations meet all local codes and pass inspection the first time. We coordinate with Southwest Gas for meter upgrades when needed and handle all permit applications. From the initial design through final inspection, you're working with one experienced team that takes full responsibility for a safe, code-compliant installation. Serving Southern Arizona for 46+ years, we've installed thousands of gas lines for homes and businesses throughout the region.
benefits: Licensed and certified for gas work under Arizona regulations
Proper BTU load calculations ensure adequate gas flow to all appliances
Only code-approved materials rated for natural gas and propane
Pressure testing and leak detection on every connection
Permit handling and inspection coordination included
Coordination with Southwest Gas for meter sizing and upgrades
Clean installation with proper support and protection
Written documentation for warranty and insurance records

process.title: Site Survey & BTU Calculation
process.description: We assess where the new gas line needs to run, measure distances, and calculate total BTU requirements based on all appliances that will use the line. This determines proper pipe sizing.

process.title: Code-Compliant Design
process.description: We design the piping route to meet all code requirements for clearances, support, and protection. If permits are required, we handle the application and schedule the inspection.

process.title: Professional Pipe Installation
process.description: Using properly sized black iron or CSST flexible gas piping, we install the new line with approved fittings and connections. All joints are secured and protected per manufacturer specifications.

process.title: Pressure Testing & Leak Detection
process.description: Before connecting any appliances, we pressure-test the new line and check every connection with gas-detection solution. The system must hold pressure and show zero leaks before we proceed.

process.title: Appliance Connection & System Verification
process.description: We connect your appliances, verify proper operation, check for correct flame patterns, and test safety shutoffs. We walk you through the new installation and provide documentation for your records.

faqs.question: How do I know if I have a gas leak?
faqs.answer: Signs of a gas leak include the smell of rotten eggs (added to natural gas for detection), hissing sounds near gas lines, dead vegetation near underground lines, and higher-than-normal gas bills. If you smell gas, leave immediately and call us or 911 from outside the home.

faqs.question: Are you licensed for gas line work in Arizona?
faqs.answer: Yes, Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC is fully licensed for gas line work under Arizona ROC license #159621. Our technicians receive specialized training and certification for gas piping systems.

faqs.question: Can you install a gas line for an outdoor grill or fire pit?
faqs.answer: Yes, we regularly extend gas lines to outdoor kitchens, grills, fire pits, and pool heaters. We handle all necessary permits and inspections to ensure the work meets code.

name: Gas Leak Repair
shortDescription: Immediate response to gas leak emergencies.
longDescription:
The smell of gas in your home demands immediate action—gas leaks can cause explosions, fires, and deadly carbon monoxide poisoning. Wood's Plumbing provides emergency gas leak repair with the urgency these dangerous situations require. If you smell rotten eggs or sulfur, hear hissing near gas lines, or notice dead vegetation near buried gas lines, leave immediately and call us.

Our gas leak specialists carry advanced electronic detection equipment that locates leaks with pinpoint accuracy, even in buried lines or behind walls. Unlike the soap bubble test that only works on accessible fittings, our combustible gas detectors sense minute concentrations in the air, leading us directly to the source. Once located, we isolate the section, make the repair with approved materials, and retest to confirm the system is safe.

Not all gas leaks present obvious warning signs. Slow leaks at old corroded fittings or aging flexible connectors may not produce a noticeable odor until concentrations reach dangerous levels. If you have older gas piping or appliances, we recommend periodic inspection to identify problems before they become emergencies. Our technicians are licensed and trained specifically for gas work, following strict safety protocols that protect your family and property.
benefits: 24/7 emergency response for gas leak situations
Electronic combustible gas detectors pinpoint hidden leaks
Trained to locate leaks in buried lines and behind walls
Licensed specifically for gas line repair in Arizona
Repairs made with code-approved materials and techniques
Post-repair pressure testing confirms system integrity
Coordination with Southwest Gas for meter-side issues
Safety inspection identifies other potential problems

process.title: Emergency Safety Protocol
process.description: Upon arrival, we survey for immediate hazards, ensure ventilation, and verify the area is safe to work. If gas concentration is dangerous, we coordinate evacuation and contact the gas utility for meter shutoff.

process.title: Electronic Leak Detection
process.description: Using professional combustible gas detectors, we trace the leak to its exact source—whether at a visible fitting, behind drywall, or underground. We won't start repairs until we've found every leak point.

process.title: Isolation & Repair
process.description: We shut off gas to the affected section and make repairs using approved materials and techniques. Whether it's a corroded fitting, damaged flex connector, or cracked pipe, we replace the failed component completely.

process.title: Pressure Test & Verification
process.description: After repairs, we pressure-test the system and recheck with gas detectors to confirm zero leaks. We won't restore service until we're certain the system is completely safe.

process.title: System Safety Inspection
process.description: Before leaving, we inspect other gas connections and appliances for developing problems—catching potential future leaks while we're there. We document all work for your records and the gas company.

name: Gas Pipe Testing
shortDescription: Professional gas pipe pressure testing and leak detection to ensure safety and code compliance.
longDescription:
Gas pipe testing is a critical safety service that verifies the integrity of your gas piping system. Whether required for real estate transactions, after remodeling work, following earthquake activity, or as part of regular safety maintenance, professional pressure testing confirms that your gas lines are leak-free and safe to operate.

Wood's Plumbing performs gas pipe testing to the standards required by Arizona code and accepted by Southwest Gas. We isolate the gas piping from appliances, pressurize the system with air or inert gas, and monitor for pressure drop over a specified period. Even tiny leaks that wouldn't be detectable by smell show up as pressure loss during testing. If a leak is found, our detection equipment locates it precisely for repair.

Many home buyers now require gas pipe testing before purchase, and lenders may make it a condition of financing for older homes. Real estate agents throughout Tucson and Southern Arizona rely on Wood's Plumbing for fast, documented testing that satisfies transaction requirements. We also test gas systems after major renovation work, following seismic activity, and for businesses that require regular safety documentation. Our test reports include pressure readings, duration, and certification that the system meets code requirements.
benefits: Certified testing meets Arizona code and Southwest Gas requirements
Detects even microscopic leaks invisible to other methods
Documentation accepted for real estate transactions
Required testing for post-construction and renovation sign-off
Identifies problems before they become dangerous leaks
Electronic leak detection pinpoints any failures for repair
Fast scheduling accommodates real estate closing timelines
Written certification for permanent records and insurance

process.title: System Preparation
process.description: We turn off gas supply and isolate the piping from all appliances. Each appliance is disconnected from the test to ensure we're testing only the permanent piping—not appliance valves or flex connectors.

process.title: Pressurization
process.description: Using a calibrated pressure gauge, we pressurize the gas piping system to the required test pressure using air or nitrogen. The pressure is monitored for the code-required duration—typically 15-30 minutes.

process.title: Leak Determination
process.description: If pressure drops during the test period, the system has failed. We then use electronic detection equipment and approved leak detection solution to locate every leak point in the piping.

process.title: Repair If Needed
process.description: When leaks are found, we provide repair options and can make corrections using code-approved materials. After repairs, we repeat the pressure test to verify success.

process.title: Certification & Documentation
process.description: Upon successful testing, we provide written certification documenting the test procedure, pressures, duration, and results. This documentation satisfies requirements for real estate transactions, permits, and insurance.

name: Gas Line Relocation
shortDescription: Safe gas line relocation for remodels, additions, and outdoor kitchens.
longDescription:
Kitchen remodels, room additions, and appliance upgrades often require moving existing gas lines to new locations. Gas line relocation isn't simply extending a pipe—it requires proper sizing calculations, code-compliant routing, and professional-grade connections that will serve safely for decades. Wood's Plumbing handles gas line relocation projects from simple stove repositioning to complex whole-room reconfigurations.

When you move a gas stove across the kitchen, add a fireplace to a remodeled living room, or relocate your water heater to a new utility area, the gas supply must follow. Our technicians evaluate the entire gas system to ensure adequate capacity, then design and install new piping that maintains proper pressure to all appliances. We properly cap and abandon old line segments, meeting code requirements that prevent future confusion about active versus inactive piping.

Gas line relocation work requires permits in most Arizona jurisdictions, and we handle all permit applications and inspections as part of our service. Our experience with Tucson-area building departments means we know exactly what inspectors require and get approvals efficiently. After completing the relocation, we pressure-test the entire system and verify proper operation of all connected appliances. Whether you're working with a general contractor on a major renovation or handling a smaller project yourself, our gas specialists deliver safe, code-compliant results.
benefits: Proper sizing ensures adequate gas flow after relocation
Code-compliant routing meets all clearance and protection requirements
Old lines properly capped and marked as abandoned per code
Permit handling and inspection coordination included
Seamless coordination with your general contractor or remodeler
Minimal disruption to other renovation work in progress
Pressure testing verifies complete system integrity
Appliance reconnection and operation verification included

process.title: Project Consultation
process.description: We review your remodel plans to understand where appliances are moving and what gas capacity is needed. We identify the optimal route for new piping and plan how to tie into existing supply.

process.title: Permit & Coordination
process.description: We handle permit applications and coordinate timing with your general contractor or project schedule. Gas work typically needs to happen at specific construction phases for inspection access.

process.title: Old Line Capping
process.description: We properly cap and abandon gas lines at their source, clearly marking abandoned sections per code. This prevents confusion during future work and ensures old lines can never be accidentally reconnected.

process.title: New Line Installation
process.description: We install properly sized gas piping to the new appliance locations, with all connections made using approved materials and techniques. Support and protection meet code requirements for exposed and concealed piping.

process.title: Testing & Commissioning
process.description: After installation, we pressure-test the modified system, reconnect all appliances, verify proper operation, and schedule the required inspection. We document everything for your project records.

name: Frozen Pipe Repair
shortDescription: Emergency service for frozen and burst pipes.
longDescription:
Frozen Pipe Repair is one of the most requested services at Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC. Whether you're dealing with an urgent situation or planning a scheduled project, our licensed plumbers deliver professional results backed by 46 years of experience serving Southern Arizona.

Many Tucson-area homes built before 1990 have galvanized steel or copper pipes that have deteriorated due to our extremely hard water. Galvanized pipes corrode from the inside, restricting flow and adding rust to your water. Copper pipes develop pinhole leaks from the acidic water chemistry. Repiping with modern PEX or CPVC solves these issues permanently.

When you choose Wood's Plumbing Enterprises LLC for frozen pipe repair, you get more than just technical expertise. You get plumbers who respect your home, communicate clearly, and stand behind their work.
